analysis.summary: Defines and exports the chat feature module for the client side. It imports the chat store and Vue components (page, window, message), provides an initialization function to register the store (and optionally router routes), and exposes the module structure for consumption by the application.
analysis.purpose: To encapsulate chat-related logic, state and UI components into a single module that can be initialized by the main application, integrating store, routes and view components for the chat feature.

functions.name: initializeChats
functions.description: Registers the chat store with the global store and (optionally) adds chat routes to the router.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: Global state/store manager where feature stores are registered

parameters.name: router
parameters.description: Router instance used for navigation and route registration

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Configuration overrides (e.g., custom route name). Defaults to { route: 'Home' }

analysis.usage: Imported as the default export in the client module loader. The application calls ModuleChats.initialize(app, store, router, options) during startup to set up the chat feature. The views and components are then available under ModuleChats.views for dynamic registration or rendering.
notes: Router setup is currently commented out; to enable chat-specific routes, uncomment and implement createChatRoutes in router/chat.router.js.
The module follows the martyrs framework convention of grouping store, router and view exports under a single object.
Options object allows overriding the base route name where chat routes will be mounted.
